subject: Politics
title: Why People Don't Vote
description: A short lesson to help you apply Why People Don't Vote.

hook.text: In the US, about 40% of eligible voters skip presidential elections. In local races, it's far worse.

buildup.text: Voter apathy has many causes: distrust, inconvenience, feeling that one vote doesn't matter.

discovery.text: Structural barriers matter too. Voter ID laws, limited polling hours, and registration hurdles suppress turnout.

twist.text: Australia made voting mandatory. Turnout is over 90%. Compulsory voting works but raises freedom questions.

climax.text: Low turnout helps incumbents and extremes. When moderates stay home, the loud minorities win.

punchline.text: Not voting is a choice. It just lets others choose for you.

quiz.question: Which country uses compulsory voting with over 90% turnout?
